homePage.quickProv: Quickly provision  your users or groups
homePage.advProv: Provision users with a guided wizard to set up Directory Sync, Single Sign-on and customized reports
homePage.convertUsersText:
Convert employees of your organization who have signed up for Project Squared on their own with a company email address to a licensed user. Licensed users receive additional enterprise fatures, and are subject to your organization's policies and administration.

Selected users will receive an invitation to convert or change their email address to a non-company email address.
homePage.name: Name

inviteModal.title: Service Entitlement
inviteModal.heading: Enable Service Entitlement
inviteModal.content: Invite users in the organization to use squared...

ssoModal.title: Setup SSO
ssoModal.enableSSO: Yes, I have a custom SSO provider.
ssoModal.disableSSO: No, I don't have a SSO provider.
ssoModal.importMetadataDesc: Begin configuring the trust relationship between your identity provider (IdP) and the Cisco Collaboration Cloud by obtaining a trust metadata file from your IdP and uploading it here.
ssoModal.exportMetadataDesc1: Download the following trust metadata file from the Cisco Collaboration service, and upload it into your identity provider (IdP) management interface.
ssoModal.exportMetadataDesc2: When you have finished uploading the file into your IdP, return to this screen and press Next.
ssoModal.testSSOSetupDesc: You are ready to test your SSO configuration. Press the button below to launch a new window. If you are able to sign in successfully, you can return to this screen and press next to finalize your SSO setup.
ssoModal.enableSSODesc: If you are ready to enable Single Sign-On (SSO) for all users, press the finish button. All user authentication will then be processed through your new SSO provider.
ssoModal.importFailed: Failed to import IdP Metadata File
ssoModal.readFileFailed: Could not read IdP Metadata file
ssoModal.enableSSOSuccess: Single Sign-On (SSO) successfully enabled for all users

serviceSetupModal.tzDescription: Specify the time zone to use for schedule-based call routing. For example, this time zone applies to calls routed based on business hours and holiday schedules.
serviceSetupModal.oddDescription: Specify the number users must dial before placing an external call.
serviceSetupModal.internalNumberRangeDescription: Specify range of internal numbers.  Length of 4 or 5 numbers are recommended.
serviceSetupModal.mohDescription: Provide callers with music, announcements, or video when they are placed on hold. You can change the MOH settings at the group or user level.

dirsyncModal.chooseSyncDesc: Do you want to manually enter users or synchronize users from Active Directory?
dirsyncModal.title: Directory Sync
dirsyncModal.domainDesc: Identify the Active Directory domain you will be syncing.
dirsyncModal.installStep1: 1. Download and Install the Cisco Cloud Connector in your enterprise.
dirsyncModal.installStep2: 2. Configure the Active Directory synchronization agreement.
dirsyncModal.nextSteps: Press the Next button when you're ready to verify that identity information is being synchronized.
dirsyncModal.autoAssignText: Auto-assign users into groups as they are synchronized
dirsyncModal.groupAssignmentDesc: Users will be aut provisoned with services based on the default entitlements and policies for the group. If you would like to change the default provisioning stettings, please visit the groups page.
dirsyncModal.getDomainFailed: Failed to retrieve Directory Sync Configuration
dirsyncModal.setDomainFailed: Failed to create Directory Sync Domain
dirsyncModal.getStatusFailed: Failed to retrieve Directory Sync Status

unauthorizedPage.title: Unauthorized
unauthorizedPage.text: You are not authorized to access the page you requested.

errors.status403: Authorization failed. You do not have administrator priviledges. You will automatically be logged out in a few seconds.
errors.status401: Authorization failed. Server unable to process authorization token. You will automatically be logged out in a few seconds.
errors.serverDown: Authorization failed. Server may be down, please contact system administrator. You will automatically be logged out in a few seconds.
errors.expired: Your session is expired or unauthorized. You will automatically be logged out in a few seconds. Please login again to continue using the service.
errors.unsupported: You are using an outdated version of Internet Explorer. Please upgrade your browser to version 11 or higher.

spacesPage.title: Devices
spacesPage.addDeviceStep1: Where will this device be installed?
spacesPage.addDeviceStep1Desc: It is recommended that you use the name of your conference room or shared space as it is shown in your company directory. The video address for this device will use this name. It will also be the easiest way to search for and find the device in the system later.
spacesPage.emptyDevices1: Once you add a new device,
spacesPage.deleteDeviceConfText: Are you sure you want to delete this device?

status.unknown: reports an unknown state. Please check the expressway for details.
status.not_configured: has installed the service, but it's not configured.
status.offline: has not posted status in a while and could be offline.
status.registered: is registered but has not yet posted status.

firstTimeWizard.simpleSub: All you need are users' email addresses
firstTimeWizard.planReviewDesc: This setup wizard will enable you to quickly get collaboration services up and running for your organization. If you're not sure what to do in any given step, don't worry, you can always make changes later.
firstTimeWizard.chooseSyncDesc: Do you want to manually enter users or synchronize users from Active Directory?
firstTimeWizard.domainDesc: Identify the Active Directory domain you will be syncing.
firstTimeWizard.installStep1: 1. Download and Install the Cisco Cloud Connector in your enterprise.
firstTimeWizard.installStep2: 2. Configure the Active Directory synchronization agreement.
firstTimeWizard.nextSteps: Press the Next button when you're ready to verify that identity information is being synchronized.
firstTimeWizard.setupSSODesc: Please select the appropriate option for your SSO configuration.
firstTimeWizard.manualInvite: Enter the email addresses of the people in your company that will receive Collaboration Services. They will receive an email invatation to sign up.
firstTimeWizard.domainSubDesc: Enter the AD domain to sync with:
firstTimeWizard.connectorSteps: Follow these steps in order to install the Cloud Connector:
firstTimeWizard.finishDesc: You have completed the setup wizard. If you have skipped steps or need to change any of the settings, click the gear icon in the upper right hand corner of the page to access this panel again.

callPark.information1: The Call Park feature allows you to place a call on hold, so it can be retrieved from another phone in the system. If you are on an active call at your phone, you can park the call to a call park extension by pressing the Park softkey or the Call Park button. Someone on another phone in your system can then dial the call park extension to retrieve the call.
callPark.information2: You can define either a single directory number or a range of directory numbers for use as call park extension numbers. You can park only one call at each call park extension number.
callPark.deleteConfirmation: This action cannot be undone. Are you sure you want to delete this Call Park?
callPark.createDescription: Allow users to place a call on hold so that it can be retrieved from another endpoint
callPark.name: Name
callPark.numbersDescription: The system will dynamically assign a call park number for the user. Alternatively, you can select specific number(s).
callPark.retrievalPrefixDescription: Dial this number before the call park number to retreive a parked call. No alpha characters.
callPark.callReversionDescription: This defines the routing of the call when it is not picked up

directoryNumberPanel.title: Line Configuration
directoryNumberPanel.internalNumberLabel: Reach this line by any of these numbers or extensions
directoryNumberPanel.deleteConfirmation: This action cannot be undone.  Are you sure you want to unassign {{line}} from {{user}}?

singleNumberReachPanel.snrNote: SNR can cover all the user's lines or limited to specific lines

singleNumberReachPanel.removeSuccess: Single Number Reach configuration removed successfully

generateActivationCodeModal.title: Activation Code
generateActivationCodeModal.activateBody: Plug in your new Cisco desk phone or TelePresence device and enter the activation code when you are prompted or use the device camera to scan the QR code.

rolesPanel.rolesDescription: A user may have one or more roles in the system, and will be granted all permissions from selected roles.
rolesPanel.cloudOpDescription: This user can also be enabled as a Cloud Operations Administrator. This role includes special permissions to view and operate the Squared system from this portal.
